page.title: 02"999"SERVICES IN BICESTER.
page.content: Law and order:The police station is in Queen's Avenue and is run by Thames Valley Police Force.At present there is an inspector,24 constables and 3 sergeants as well as 4 CID men.The station has 3 cells for short-stay prisoners and it is linked by computer to the rest of the Thames Valley force. Fire Service:The fire station in Queen's Avenue is manned by 18 part-time firemen who wear bleepers to call them to emergencies.There are 2 fire engines with turntable ladders and practises are held every Tuesday night. Ambulance Station:This adjoins the fire station and has 2 ambulances and full time crews which operate day and night. Hospital:The nearest general hospital is in Oxford but the town has a small cottage hospital which caters for the elderly on a short-term basis and provides out-patient clinics.
